vtkTest.py

00001 from vtk import *
00002 
00003 import matplotlib
00004 matplotlib.use('Agg')
00005 from matplotlib.figure import Figure
00006 from matplotlib.backends.backend_agg import FigureCanvasAgg
00007 import pylab as p
00008 
00009 # The vtkImageImporter will treat a python string as a void pointer
00010 importer = vtkImageImport()
00011 importer.SetDataScalarTypeToUnsignedChar()
00012 importer.SetNumberOfScalarComponents(4)
00013 
00014 # It's upside-down when loaded, so add a filp filter
00015 imflip = vtkImageFlip()
00016 imflip.SetInput(importer.GetOutput())
00017 imflip.SetFilteredAxis(1)
00018 
00019 # Map the plot as a texture on a cube
00020 cube = vtkCubeSource()
00021 
00022 cubeMapper = vtkPolyDataMapper()
00023 cubeMapper.SetInput(cube.GetOutput())
00024 
00025 cubeActor = vtkActor()
00026 cubeActor.SetMapper(cubeMapper)
00027 
00028 # Create a texure based off of the image
00029 cubeTexture = vtkTexture()
00030 cubeTexture.InterpolateOn()
00031 cubeTexture.SetInput(imflip.GetOutput())
00032 cubeActor.SetTexture(cubeTexture)
00033 
00034 ren = vtkRenderer()
00035 ren.AddActor(cubeActor)
00036 
00037 renWin = vtkRenderWindow()
00038 renWin.AddRenderer(ren)
00039 
00040 iren = vtkRenderWindowInteractor()
00041 iren.SetRenderWindow(renWin)
00042 
00043 # Now create our plot
00044 fig = Figure()
00045 canvas = FigureCanvasAgg(fig)
00046 ax = fig.add_subplot(111)
00047 ax.grid(True)
00048 ax.set_xlabel('Hello from VTK!', size=16)
00049 ax.bar(xrange(10), p.rand(10))
00050 
00051 # Powers of 2 image to be clean
00052 w,h = 1024, 1024
00053 dpi = canvas.figure.get_dpi()
00054 fig.set_figsize_inches(w / dpi, h / dpi)
00055 canvas.draw() # force a draw
00056 
00057 # This is where we tell the image importer about the mpl image
00058 extent = (0, w - 1, 0, h - 1, 0, 0)
00059 importer.SetWholeExtent(extent)
00060 importer.SetDataExtent(extent)
00061 importer.SetImportVoidPointer(canvas.buffer_rgba(0,0), 1)
00062 importer.Update()
00063 
00064 iren.Initialize()
00065 iren.Start()
